alert.note: Alert for Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 3:06AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Oconee. * WHEN...Until 615 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Nuisance to minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past 60-90 minutes. - Heavy rainfall is lifting from Seneca to Salem and conditions will gradually improve over the next hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain may exacerbate ongoing flooding or cause new areas of flooding to develop. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Seneca, and areas adjacent to Lake Keowee.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
